TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ConnectionPolicy extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the connection policy associated with a DocumentClient to connect to the Azure DocumentDB database service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to connect to the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Gets or sets the connection mode used by the client when connecting to the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: For more information, see Connection policy: Use direct connection mode.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the connection protocol when connecting to the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: This setting is not used when is set to . Gateway mode only supports HTTPS. For more information, see Connection policy: Use the TCP protocol.

Docs.summary: Gets the default connection policy used to connect to the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: Refer to the default values for the individual properties of that determine the default connection policy.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the flag to enable endpoint discovery for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: When the value of this property is true, the SDK will automatically discover the current write and read regions to ensure requests are sent to the correct region based on the regions specified in the property. Default value is true indicating endpoint discovery is enabled.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for the target service endpoint in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: This setting is only applicable in Gateway mode.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attachment content (a.k.a. media) download mode when connecting to the Azure DocumentDB database service.

Gets or sets the media request timeout in seconds when connecting to the Azure DocumentDB database service. The number specifies the time to wait for response to come back from network peer for attachment content (a.k.a. media) operations.
Gets and sets the preferred locations (regions) for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure DocumentDB database service. For example, "East US" as the preferred location.

remarks.para: When is true and the value of this property is non-empty, the SDK uses the locations in the collection in the order they are specified to perform operations, otherwise if the value of this property is not specified, the SDK uses the write region as the preferred location for all operations.
If is set to false, the value of this property is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the request timeout in seconds when connecting to the Azure DocumentDB database service. The number specifies the time to wait for response to come back from network peer.
Gets or sets the associated with the in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: If this property is not set, the SDK uses the default retry policy that has set to 9 and set to 30 seconds.
Docs.remarks: For more information, see Handle rate limiting/request rate too large.

Docs.summary: A suffix to be added to the default user-agent for the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: Setting this property after sending any request won't have any effect.
